item.title: Fly tipping issue marked as fixed despite waste still being present, 12th January
item.description:
A recent report about fly tipping on chai walk was marked as fixed by fixmystreet. The issue is not resolved as the fly tipped waste is still present.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mount Pleasant Lane, Hackney, London

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 12th January

item.title: Several dog poo bags thrown onto floor, 12th January
item.description:
Dog poo bags are filling up, seemingly from the same owner. Over the last couple of weeks I've seen a new bag be added almost daily. They've been left on the floor at the side of the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19, Caygill Close, Shortlands, Greater London

item.title: The main drains outside our house is blocked, 12th January
item.description:
Please can you unblock the leaves and the compacted soil that is blocking the water drains and gutter outside 72 Hyde Vale.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hyde Vale, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water is glowing down the road along the curb side. Not great amounts., 12th January
item.description:
I am unable to see properly what the issue exactly is, as big taxi is parked over the top of the drain. I think the drain looks blocked but I could see water almost flowing out of the drain but as I say I cannot see the issue fully. A small flow of water is heading down the road towards Wickham road. I think this might have been an issue recently as there was a lot of ice in front of the opening to the Redlands building when we had freezing temperatures about a week ago.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Downs Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Case number 8673154, 12th January
item.description:

item.title: Abandoned Wheelie Bin, 12th January
item.description:
On Plumstead High Street, near the junction with Wickham Lane. This Green Wheelie bin has been left on the pavement for three weeks. It is full of general waste but because it is a Green bin the regular collections for Black and Blue bins ignore it. Almost every day more waste if added to the bin which is overflowing onto the pavement. The bin and rubbish need to be removed

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wickham Lane, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter everwhere in roads and pavements, 12th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Wisley Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Case number 8570519 broken bollard, 12th January
item.description:
I reported the broken bollard on 18th December 2025. You quickly removed it and replaced it with a rubber reflective cone as the raised concrete area in the middle of the road is unlit and dangerous for drivers. Today I noticed that the rubber cone has been removed therefore exposing drivers to the dangerous unlit raised concrete base in the muddle of the road again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 290, Erith Road, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This public alleyway has not been swept for over 6 months!!!, 12th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fives Court, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken cover, 12th January
item.description:
There it is a broken cover this location with a big hole in it I thought that you might want to fix this before somebody hurts to themselves but obviously not as I did to report this probably a year maybe longer ago new said you were waiting six months for a new cover which sounds like a load of rubbish because it's just a generic size looking after the park is obviously very difficult for you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crab Hill, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
